column4: Does anyone know of a way to log out another user, so I can use the 'deluser' function?
kill all the users processes
Somthing seemed odd about the way you prased that.. X starts a X server.. Unless of course you are using vnc.
basically, i want a command that will start a brand new xfce session.
start it where?  a new desktop?
(Without using the graphical login screen -- just from a command line)
you want to spawn a new X session that runs xfce, on  a new tty? so alt-ctrl-F8 gets to the new session?
? I currently have no GUI running. I want to start xfce, instead of gnome which launces with startx
You can make a .xinitrc that will launch whatever you want. :)
yes. A new X session that has xfce
i forget what  starts XFCE desktop however.
how do i do that
that will make startx, just run xfce.
make a file named .xinitrc  put whatever commands ya want in it.
wait, what file do i put the commands in?
each user CAN have a .xinitrc file in their home dir. If its there then 'startx' runs whats in that file. Not the system wide defaults
example .xinitrc file (2 lines)   xterm &    exec gnome-session
jwm
bettetr to ask what your NEEDS are
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
i can't just change the screen resolution for one particular session without having to reconfigure X?
gnome/kde have some xrandr tools/features that can let the user change their res. If its enabled properly
